sentences.english: Hindus are taught that “truth is one, the sages give it various names.”
sentences.chinese: 印度教训示“真理唯一，哲人以不同名字称谓之。”

sentences.english: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying.
And the Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, saying.
sentences.chinese: 上主在西乃旷野训示梅瑟说。

sentences.english: And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 上主在埃及国训示梅瑟和亚郎说。

sentences.english: The real association is with the instructions of the spiritual teacher.
sentences.chinese: 真正的联谊是与灵性导师的训示同在的。

sentences.english: Christians try to live out their lives following the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 基督徒力图按照《圣经》的训示去生活。

sentences.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses in mount Sinai, saying.
sentences.chinese: 上主在西乃山训示梅瑟说。

sentences.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, and Aaron, saying.
sentences.chinese: 上主训示梅瑟和亚郎说。

definition: imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
variant of 訓誡|训诫[xun4 jie4]
to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish
to issue a directive/to instruct (that sth be done)
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
variant of 告誡|告诫[gao4 jie4]
to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
